name: Sudirman (singer)
description:
[[Malay styles and titles#State titles|Dato']] '''Sudirman bin''' [[Hajji|Haji]] '''Arshad''' (25 May 1954 – 22 February 1992), known [[Mononymous person|mononymously]] as '''Sudirman''', was a [[Malaysians|Malaysian]] singer, songwriter and actor. His singing career kicked off after winning the Bintang RTM singing competition on 11 August, 1976. His career defining moment came after he was awarded winner of the "1989 Asia's No. 1 Performer" title during the ‘'Asian Popular Music Awards'’ competition held at the [[Royal Albert Hall]] in London on 19 March, 1989. 
Throughout his career, he was known as the "Singing Lawyer", the "People's Singer", the "Patriotic Singer" and the "[[Elvis Presley]] and [[Claude François]] of Malaysia". Apart from being a singer and actor, he was also a lawyer, a composer, writer (specifically focused in producing memoirs and children books), cartoonist, and entrepreneur.

He represented Malaysia at the 1985 [[ABU Popular Song Contest]].
